alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan; Knox; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 4:04PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Harlan, Bell, south central Knox and southeastern Whitley Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 403 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Wilkerson to near Noetown to Harrogate. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Middlesboro and Noetown around 415 PM EDT. Binghamtown and Hutch around 420 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Meldrum, Ferndale, Davisburg, Wheeler, Cubage, Clear Creek Springs, Oaks, Pineville, East Pineville, Wasioto, Ingram, Kayjay, Ponza, Wallsend, Straight Creek, Calvin and Pathfork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential downpours are also occurring with this storm and may lead to ponding of water on roadways or localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
